title: Weird serif font
content:
This is a shop sign called Hidden Treasure. It's odd, and I can't track it down.

Font: 

 Parismatch 

Solved By: 

 [Mike F](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008063037/http:/typophile.com/user/3368 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-08-25 at 13.27.36.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008063037/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-08-25%20at%2013.27.36.png) | 84.12 KB |
author: jamesmillner

comments.content:
I've had no luck finding this either. It is possible that it is a one-off.

Lots of different typefaces with similar individual letters, but no one that replicates it as a whole.

Perhaps someone else will recognize it....
It looks like FLOP Design's [Paris Match](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008063037/http:/www.flopdesign.com/fonts/index.html) (1st font 2nd row) - manually heavied up.

**Parismatch Regular** [Flop Design, 2003]  
PS: I'm too slow :)  
PS2: Mike the row depends on your browser resolution. In my browser it's the 14th on first row.
